title: Liverpool consider risking a points deduction by playing Joel Matip during frustrating Africa Cup of Nations dispute
text:

Liverpool have been left with an agonising decision over whether to select Joel Matip this week. 
Reds boss Jurgen Klopp left his centre-half out of the visit to arch-rivals Manchester United on Sunday, because world governing body FIFA failed to give a ruling over whether he would be eligible to play in the match. 
The Cameroonian has been called up to play for his country in this month’s Africa Cup of Nations — despite announcing his international retirement over a year ago. 
When he refused to go, his nation’s bosses angrily declared they would invoke FIFA regulations which state he cannot play for his club for the entire duration of the competition. Matip played at the World Cup in Brazil but now says his international days are over (Photo: Getty) Read More 
Liverpool responded by telling FIFA they believe the regulations don’t apply because of his retirement... but failed to get any response. 
Instead, the world governing body simply referred the Premier League club back to its regulations. 
Now Klopp must decide whether to proceed without any decisive judgement from FIFA by picking Matip to play in Wednesday night’s FA Cup third-round replay at Plymouth, despite the threat of potential sanctions.
